text.name: longdescription
text.text: Sega Model 3 is an arcade platform released in 1996 as the successor to Sega Model 2. It had an IBM-Motorola PowerPC 603e CPU that could run at 66, 100 or 166 MHz, 33 MB of RAM and two Lockheed Martin Real3D/Pro-1000 GPUs. Model 3 was followed by Sega Naomi in 1998 which uses a similar architecture to the Sega Dreamcast.
